page.title: 13DERELICT LAND.
page.content: In the area there is very little derelict land. The fields without crops were mostly overgrown tall grasses,wild flowers,and weeds. The north east region near Whittle Brook contained an isolated Smallpox Hospital which was demolished with only the 3m perimeter wall intact. The area outside the wall was also waste ground. Whittle Brook flows behind the hospital and seemed to be fairly clear. North of the brook another derelict area was discovered, this was very rough undulating land. This area was once used by the American Airforce as a dump for refuse. It is mainly used for motorbike scrambling. Many wild plants could be found including Foxglove. Southeast of the map was heavily industrialised but many buildings had been demolished.
